title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 May 2016 - XWiki
content:
<lkrejci> has quit  
00:48 <abusenius> has quit  
05:48 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
06:09 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
07:07 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
07:52 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
07:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:07 <cjd> has quit  
08:26 <D-Spair> has quit  
08:26 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <gene> has quit  
08:31 <gene> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <Denis> has quit  
08:47 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <vmassol> has quit  
08:53 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:57 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <vmassol1> good monring  
09:29 <vmassol1> seems we have a failing tests in oldcore: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Quality/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-oldcore/3114/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki.doc/XWikiDocumentMockitoTest/testObjectNumbersAfterXMLRoundrip/  
09:30 <vmassol1> mflorea: good morning  
09:30 <vmassol1> mflorea: we need to get ready to release on Monday  
09:32 <vmassol1> hmm seems I forgot to send the 8.2 roadmap proposal, doing it  
09:32 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <mflorea> vmassol, ClemensR can you check whether your recent change to RSS macro is causing  
09:38 <mflorea> Rule violated for bundle XWiki Platform - Rendering - Macro - RSS: instructions covered ratio is 0.78, but expected minimum is 0.80  
09:39 <mflorea> it fails since a long time http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Quality-8.1.x/  
09:40 <mflorea> so it's ClemensR most probably, or seanthegeek's PR  
09:41 <ClemensR> ah, its that patch, I forgot I had some part in it  
09:41 <vmassol1> there are also 3 new failing tests at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Quality/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-tool-standards-validator/3114/testReport/  
09:41 <ClemensR> I know that mystriouasly I broke the escle tests for getuserandgrous.vm, but not that one  
09:41 <vmassol1> ClemensR: I think you mentioned something about them yesterday but I wasn't paying attention  
09:42 <vmassol1> hmm on the other side, this SO issue is not new  
09:42 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
09:42 <vmassol> apparently we got it to pass on the 13th of may: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform\_Quality/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-tool-standards-validator/  
09:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: testObjectNumbersAfterXMLRoundrip seems to be only in sonar build for some reason, I saw it in the past but was only in some agent and I could never reproduce it locally  
09:48 <vmassol> yes it's only with the quality profile  
09:49 <tmortagne> even quality profile is not enought to reproduce locally  
09:49 <tmortagne> at least I could not (always building with -Pquality)  
09:51 <vmassol> yep I couldn't reproduce either  
09:51 <mflorea> I can reproduce it locall  
09:51 <mflorea> locally  
09:51 <vmassol> ah cool  
09:51 <ClemensR> hmpf, I cannot reproduce the Rendering - Macro - RSS  issue locally, even when building with -Pquality .  seems I forgot a maven profile  ... me reading docs  
09:51 <mflorea>  Cannot find property class com.xpn.xwiki.objects.classes.StaticListClass in MetaClass object  
09:54 <ClemensR> ah, that rss / covered ratio issue is only on the 8.1 branch, thats why ... now reproduced  
09:58 <mflorea> vmassol: I get this when I start XWiki 8.2-SNAPSHOT  
09:58 <mflorea> Caused by: org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.rendering.configuration.ExtendedRenderingConfiguration] hint = [default]]  
09:59 <mflorea> and the panels are broken  
09:59 <mflorea> the following is printed instead of the panel output  
09:59 <mflorea> $services.rendering.render($panelUix.execute(), "xhtml/1.0")  
10:01 <vmassol> you probably don't have a full build IMO  
10:01 <vmassol> because func tests work fine and XE was wroking fine for me too  
10:01 <vmassol> I'll rebuild just in case  
10:01 <mflorea> I don't do full build, I take the snapshot from CI  
10:02 <mflorea> but maybe CI didn't build eveerything  
10:02 <vmassol> it should have  
10:02 <vmassol> I build from enterprise usually  
10:02 <vmassol> (so I get the artifacts from ci)  
10:03 <vmassol> rebuilding  
10:03 <vmassol> haha  
10:03 <vmassol> forgoto to push stuff in enterprise it seems  
10:03 <vmassol> yep that's it  
10:03 <vmassol> thanks for noticing  
10:03 <vmassol> strange thaty func tests pass without this  
10:04 <vmassol> should be better with this commit ^^  
10:04 <tmortagne> vmassol: they don't :)  
10:04 <vmassol> tmortagne: :)  
10:05 <vmassol> for some reason I forgot to check them on ci...  
10:05 <tmortagne> platform test are passing but they don't need XE  
10:05 <vmassol> only checked platform  
10:05 <vmassol> yep  
10:05 <vmassol> for platform it's only the packager plugin that needs ot be ok  
10:06 <vmassol> btw I didn't test the platform distribution but I did put the correct deps in there  
10:06 <vmassol> do we have a func test for it thomas?  
10:06 <vmassol> checking  
10:06 <vmassol> doesn't seem so  
10:06 <vmassol> hmm we'll need to improve this, to do at least some smoke test  
10:08 <tmortagne> yes, did not had time yet some full stack tests for this distribution  
10:12 <mflorea> re escaping tests it seems they are testing for XML escaping on JSON output which doesn't make sense  
10:17 <ClemensR> mflorea: I agree :)  I just wonder why they have passed before.  My change uses jsontool which returns all in one line; before the same output was split over several lines  
10:17 <mflorea> yes, the only change is the JSON formatting  
10:18 <mflorea> the failure is probably related to the way the XML validator parses the "xml" content  
10:20 <mflorea> with the previous formatting the >< chars were considered ok, with the current formatting they are bad. In any case, we shouldn't use XML validator with JSON  
10:20 <mflorea> we need a JSON "validator"  
10:23 <mflorea> it seems getusersandgroups.vm is generating JSON from the start (13 Feb 2008) so I don't understand how we ended up using the XML validator  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:38 <ClemensR> hm, I think the fix for XWIKI-13284 could be simplified a little, thus meeting the quality standards, but I am afraid to touch the code as I cannot reproduce the issue locally. I guess I will only decrease the expected coverage, as it already happened on the master  
10:42 <mflorea> I'm looking at the escaping tests  
10:46 <tmortagne> "how we ended up using the XML validator" we use validator on all vm automatically except those that are explicitly excluded, I guess we just did not noticed before that the validation was failing and forgot to exclude it  
10:46 <tmortagne> just need to add it in XE test pom  
10:47 <tmortagne> we already have stuff in there excluded because "generates JSON"  
10:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:48 <vmassol> -2% ClemensR, starting to be a lot ;) lol  
10:49 <vmassol> (from 80% to 78%)  
10:50 <Denis> Hi devs, I just replied on the dev ML, where a user was confused by the "Adminitrater Parent" option on a terminal page, and wants to manage right on the page. Obviously, this is counter intuitive to have to find the edit Rights option, and also this not an option you get as a simple user. Is there any plan on evolving that soon ?  
10:51 <ClemensR> actually the code looks redundant and looks like it could be fixed easily back in the 80% regime, but as I cannot reproduce the original issue ... :-/  
10:51 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <Denis> this edit right being accessible to advanced user only looks even inconsistent with the page administration, which allow editing right of the page, even for simple user  
11:00 <Denis> another, quite confusing situation is the administer parent option, since it provide page right edition on the WebPreference page, if I get it well  
11:04 <mflorea> tmortagne: no, this is different, it's about explicit tests  
11:05 <mflorea> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/escaping/UsersAndGroupsTest.java  
11:05 <mflorea> e.g. testGetUsersAndGroups  
11:05 <tmortagne> then it indeed does not make any sense if that document template always been JSON  
11:05 <mflorea> yes  
11:06 <Denis> oh, no it is on the webhome parent, but it is not obvious, but more consistent indeed, curious to check if no webhome exists  
11:06 <mflorea> I'm going to replace the XML validator with a JSON parser just to verify that the JSON is valid  
11:06 <mflorea> only for these tests ofc  
11:07 <tmortagne> look like the goal was not really to validate XML on it, XML validation is just a bonus you get in those tests...  
11:08 <tmortagne> ideally we should skip validation based on the mime type of the response (and later add support for JSON validation)  
11:08 <tmortagne> that way we would not have to explicitely excelude stuff like we do  
11:09 <tmortagne> as a bonus it also check that we put the right content type in the response  
11:11 <vmassol> Denis: "Is there any plan on evolving that soon ?". short answer: no  
11:11 <vmassol> no = I don't know anyone working on that  
11:11 <vmassol> if a proposal and PR materializes though then it could happen I guess  
11:11 <vmassol> right now the workaround is to read the doc  
11:13 <Denis> well, ok, but this is definitely a mess, not understandable from a user POV, I just checked the last case, setting right on administer parent could even create that parent !  
11:14 <vmassol> sure  
11:14 <vmassol> it's not like it's not known  
11:15 <vmassol> right now it's even more important to fix the fully broken stuff re NS  
11:15 <vmassol> FTR I've made a roadmap proposal on the list this morning  
11:15 <vmassol> if you're interested to participate to something for XWiki 8.2 please reply to it with what you could work on Denis!  
11:16 <vmassol> "fix the fully broken stuff re NS" and even for that, there's nobody assigned  
11:17 <Denis> there is no mention in your mail, isn't it ?  
11:18 <vmassol> of what?  
11:19 <vmassol> the mail only talks about stuff agreed with xwiki sas devs  
11:19 <Denis> polishing/fixing NS issues  
11:20 <Denis> sorry, I though it was part of the roadmap discussed, and a priority, but that we were lacking jira issues  
11:20 <vmassol> oh no we have plenty of jira issues ;)  
11:25 <Denis> so it just means that we have no plan to work on this during 8.2 ?  
11:26 <ClemensR> tmortagne: about MOCCACAL-102 I guess will release the workaround, maybe even today, or did you get any feedback so far?  
11:27 <tmortagne> ClemensR: sorry, did not had the time to test but from what I understood it's look better, lets say I trust you :)  
11:28 <tmortagne> important things is not less forget the all day thing  
11:28 <vmassol> Denis: it means there's nobody from the xwiki sas devs assigned to work on NS stuff indeed. Except for BFD ofc  
11:28 <ClemensR> ok, I do not really trust me on this, but I guess it is worth a try anyway ;)  
11:28 <tmortagne> yes  
11:29 <Denis> vmassol: BFD are for low hanging fruit, so not really adapted  
12:35 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <woshilapin> has quit  
12:49 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <tmortagne> mflorea, ClemensR: escape test on unsupported content type (anything but XML right now) don't fail anymore (but log a warning)  
13:19 <ClemensR> cool  
13:19 <tmortagne> looks like we have 5 test in this case  
13:20 <tmortagne> need to do the same kind of thing for xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards probably  
13:20 <tmortagne> (ideally refactor all this mess to have a common framework for those two)  
13:20 <mflorea> tmortagne: I was working on the same thing.. :(  
13:20 <tmortagne> mflorea: you talked about supported JSON  
13:21 <tmortagne> you can still add your JSON related work in the if I added  
13:21 <tmortagne> I just skip anything that was not XML  
13:22 <tmortagne> in AbstractEscapingTest#getUnderEscapingErrors  
13:24 <lucaa> has quit  
13:24 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <cjd> has quit  
14:25 <lucaa> has quit  
14:32 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <cjd\_> has quit  
15:01 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:07 <cjd> has quit  
15:07 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:13 <cjd> has quit  
15:26 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <vmassol> Denis: done, renamed "Rendering" into "Syntaxes"  
15:43 <vmassol> Denis: now we have till the end of 8.2 to find a way to display active syntaxes instead of disabled ones...  
16:07 <fitz> Hi everyone, Please help me! :)  
16:07 <fitz> I have tried to build the android-authenticator app in the jenkins ci.  
16:07 <fitz> But there are some errors in the build process. (Contrib - Android Authenticator#5)  
16:07 <fitz> [DEBUG] [org.gradle.api.Task] AAPT err(Facade for 98405321): /home/hudsonagent/android-sdk/build-tools/23.0.0/aapt: error while loading shared libraries: libz.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory  
16:08 <fitz> Maybe it's because Android SDK is compiled for a 32-bit GNU/Linux system, but the server is a 64-bit system.  
16:08 <fitz> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/17020298/android-sdks-build-tools-17-0-0-aapt-error-while-loading-shared-libraries-libz/21505268#21505268  
16:08 <fitz> To solve this error, install the 32-bit versions of all the most commonly used libraries, by installing the ia32-libs package  
16:08 <fitz> But I have no permission so that can't intall the ia32-libs. could someone help me?  
16:13 <Enygma`> tmortagne: know anything about fitz's issue?  
16:14 <tmortagne> fitz: sorry I have to go and I don't have this kind of right in the agents  
16:15 <tmortagne> Enygma`: could you ask Fabio to install ia32-libs package ?  
16:15 <tmortagne> fitz: there is no 64b version of the SDK ?  
16:20 <mflorea> tmortagne, vmassol, Denis: can you move the issues that are assigned to you and that you don't plan to work for 8.1 final? Thanks.  
16:20 <vmassol> mflorea: will do, do you have the link around?  
16:21 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%228.1%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Unresolved%22%29  
16:21 <vmassol> thx  
16:21 <mflorea> lots of issues "planned" for 8.1 final..  
16:21 <vmassol> hmm I wanted to work on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13416 during yesterday's BFD but didn't get the time  
16:22 <vmassol> let's see if I can fix it quickly  
16:22 <Enygma`> mflorea: I want to commit http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13290 in a couple of minutes  
16:23 <mflorea> Enygma` if it's safe go ahead, I'm just preparing the release for Monday  
16:23 <vmassol> this one is an easy one too: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12931  
16:25 <vmassol> done  
16:25 <mflorea> thanks  
16:26 <mflorea> moving the 2 unassigned improvements  
16:32 <mflorea> has quit  
16:35 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
16:35 <vmassol> oh nice )  
16:35 <vmassol> :)  
16:58 <msmeria> has quit  
17:00 <fitz> hi Enygma` , tmortagne. I googled it a bit. Maybe there's no 64b compiled version. And the sdk tools, like adb and fastboot, are also compiled for 32bit system.  
17:01 <fitz> Installing ia32-libs should be the most direct and common way to develop and build android apps.  
17:01 <Enygma`> fitz: I googled too (a bit) and came to the same conclusion  
17:02 <Enygma`> but the stackoverflow link you gave was suggesting that the ia32-libs solution is not working anymore and that the lib32z1 and libstdc++6:i386 packages should be installed instead  
17:02 <Enygma`> anyway, I`ve relayed the request and all 3 packages are now installed on the 1-1 agent  
17:02 <Enygma`> let`s try to trigger a build on that agent to see if it works now  
17:02 <Enygma`> I`ll do it  
17:03 <fitz> :) thanks a lot.  
17:04 <tmortagne> back, thanks Enygma`for taking care of it  
17:05 <Enygma`> fitz: unfortunately the build agents are very busy right now and it could take a while for the #6 build of the authenticator job to get scheduled and run  
17:12 <Enygma`> fitz: so apparently we have installed just lib32z1 for now on the 1-1 agent. If that does not fix it, we can try the others, but one at a time to avoid installing unneded things  
17:13 <fitz> Ok, many thanks for helping me, Enygma` !  I'll look at the #6 build later. Thank you very much. :)  
17:13 <cjd> has quit  
17:14 <woshilapin> has quit  
17:15 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
17:22 <evalica> has quit  
17:27 <fitz> Well, I have another problem. It's my first time to use JIRA. I don't know how to close my issue?  
17:27 <fitz> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/ANDAUTH-1  
17:27 <fitz> it seems that I do not have this permission. But I should be able to mark the issue resolved.  
17:27 <tmortagne> fitz: you probably don't have the right to close the issue, let me check  
17:27 <fitz> yes there is no such resolved option to select?  
17:28 <fitz> I just can change the status to In Progress, and I have tried JIRA smart commit but it didn't work.  
17:28 <tmortagne> should be ok  
17:28 <tmortagne> you are now the leader of the project  
17:30 <fitz> that's ok! thank you so much, my mentor! :)  
17:40 <tmortagne> vmassol: I get something weird with 7.4 as parent pom in an extension, my groupid is "org.xwiki.contrib.oidc" and I end up with "You cannot use a group id starting with [org.xwiki] since that's reserved for the XWiki Core Committers"  
17:40 <tmortagne> I hope we don't really just check if the groupid starts with "org.xwiki"...  
17:43 <Denis> has quit  
17:43 <tmortagne> yep that's it, the group id can only be exactly "org.xwiki.contrib" or not start with "org.xwiki" at all, not very nice  
17:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: looks like a bug  
17:52 <tmortagne> created XCOMMONS-979  
17:52 <vmassol> ok  
18:02 <tmortagne> I'm not really sure this test is really that useful  
18:03 <tmortagne> basically it's just about preventing project that have xwiki-commons as parent to use something like "org.xwiki.<unknownmodule>", I don't think it really worth the trouble  
18:03 <tmortagne> vmassol ?  
18:05 <tmortagne> I would probably to just get rid of it  
18:05 <tmortagne> s/probably/propose/  
18:08 <tmortagne> vmassol: WDYT ?  
18:09 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
18:10 <tmortagne> or then we modify checkNonCoreArtifactId() to check that the groupid starts with "org.xwiki.contrib" which will get the same result than what was intended  
18:12 <tmortagne> no not exactly since this one is about artifact id but add the method just near this one that check for "org.xwiki.contrib"  
18:13 <tmortagne> removing the check for now since it's doing more harm than good, we can always introduce a new one later  
18:13 <vmassol> back, reading  
18:14 <vmassol> "I would probably to just get rid of it" I don't understand why. We don't want contrib projects to use that  
18:14 <vmassol> it's a reserved namespace  
18:14 <vmassol> it's very importnat for me  
18:15 <vmassol> i'm -1 to remove the check tmortagne  
18:15 <vmassol> basically the check's intent is:  
18:15 <vmassol> - allow org.xwiki.contrib.\*  
18:15 <tmortagne> then as I said it's really not the right way to check than, just need to check if the groupid start with "org.xwiki.contrib" inside isXWikiCoreCommitterExtension else  
18:16 <vmassol> - as an exception, allow some modules that were moved from commons/rendering/platform/enterprise as an interim solution  
18:16 <vmassol> sure  
18:16 <vmassol> I'm just commenting on "removing the check for now"  
18:16 <vmassol> that one would be a real regression ;)  
18:16 <tmortagne> less than the current situation  
18:17 <vmassol> the current situation is not a regression  
18:17 <vmassol> since there was no check before  
18:17 <vmassol> but yes it's not good  
18:17 <tmortagne> of course it is because it's impossible to upgrade de depending of existing extensions  
18:17 <vmassol> and the right solution is to to allow org.xwiki.contrib.\*  
18:17 <tmortagne> s/depending/dependency/  
18:17 <vmassol> you can skip the check if need be so it's impossible  
18:17 <vmassol> \*not  
18:17 <vmassol> but again the solution is not to remove the check  
18:18 <vmassol> it's to fix the bug  
18:19 <vmassol> I can do it if you don't want to do it, but not now  
18:19 <vmassol> in the meantime you can skip the check in your pom as a workaround  
18:21 <vmassol> btw we might want to introduce a way to make it easy to skip just this check  
18:21 <vmassol> (and not all enforcer checks)  
18:21 <vmassol> hmmm this might already be possible with the enforcer acutally  
18:21 <vmassol> using the proper maven execution id combined with a skip config  
18:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: looks like there is a bug in org.xwiki.tool.enforcer.ValidateDependencyVersion too, it's complaining that I don't use ${project.version} for xwiki-platform-oldcore  
18:55 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
18:56 <vmassol> :( I really need to add unit tests. I did this in a hurry….  
18:57 <vmassol> ah no you're talking about an old stuff here  
18:57 <tmortagne> nop  
18:57 <tmortagne> 7.4  
18:57 <tmortagne> unless it's different in more recent versions of 7.4.x  
18:57 <vmassol> ValidateDependencyVersion dates back to 4.5  
18:58 <tmortagne> introduced in ValidateDependencyVersion yes  
18:58 <vmassol> you mean I introuced a regression when I refactored it?  
18:58 <vmassol> (when I refactored for "Add POM validation rules")  
18:58 <tmortagne> no in that case I think it's something else  
18:58 <vmassol> ok  
18:59 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
18:59 <tmortagne> looks like this check does not look at current groupid and is fully based on stuff configured in the pom and in this specific case I used platform as parent for this extension  
19:00 <tmortagne> it should probably check if current groupid is the same than dependency groupid  
19:01 <tmortagne> anyway it's easy to fix on my side  
19:02 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
19:13 <Pbas> has quit  
19:37 <moep> has joined #xwiki  
19:44 <fitz> has quit
